lines.text: When I go to confession I don't offer God small sins, petty squabbles, jealousies... I offer him sins worth forgiving!
[first lines]
No point in me staying here any longer. Keep her warm. If she recovers consciousness, give her a little brandy.
And if she doesn't, doctor?
Send for the priest.
Oh God.
Nothing more I can do.
Landlord.
There is sickness in the house.
I can see that. Nothing a few litres of wine won't put right.
Have you anything to say in your defense?
I was attacked. I defended myself.
I am not refering to this.
[reveals severed hand]
That's a mess for the civil authorities.
During the time that I've been here, you've tried to teach me that confession of my sins is good for the soul.
Well?
You also tried to remove all temptations from us so that there's no chance of any sin here. I've merely tried to put that right.
He won't die. He is the devil. I've tried to kill him, but he won't die.

I only know I have this power. I have always had this power. I can feel it burning within me, driving me on. It is here inside me. It is in my hands. And I warn you, I warn you all that I, Grigory Yefimovich Rasputin, intend to use it. The power is mine and I will continue to use it as I please.
My sister's dead. You killed her.
How clever of me. Without even touching her.
You told her to destroy herself.
She did as she was told. What a good little girl.
Poor little Peter, frightened of the dark.
[last lines]
He's dead. Boris, he's...
